channel.title: Youtube/Vimeo Gallery XML/AS3
channel.description:
Well. You all didn't seem to like my last project. :( But this one is better, I swear.
I present to you: My Youtube video player. Not only does it load youtube video's. But it also can load Vimeo videos. And of course, videos from custom url's. Examples: Vimeo: [code=xml] <media type="vimeo" width="720" height="405" thumb="images/thumb19.jpg" title="Video 20"> <url>50671807</url> <description> <![CDATA[Some Random Assed Video off Vimeo.]]> </description> </media> [/code] Make sure to set "type" to "vimeo" All you do is add the end of the vimeo videos there. It's always a string of numbers. Youtube: [code=xml] <media type="youtube" width="720" height="405" thumb="images/thumb20.jpg" title="Video 19"> <url>http://www.youtube.com/embed/9bZkp7q19f0</url> <description> <![CDATA[Some Random Assed Video off Youtube.]]> </description> </media> [/code] Set "type" to "youtube". Then find a url off youtube, say: http://www.you tube.com/watch?v=9bZkp7q19f0 And change "watch?v=" to "embed/" You're done. Custom Video: Wait.. What's a custom video? I mean custom video as in one loaded off a domain, ending with .flv. Flash supports .flv only, which is a downfall, but. Yeah, it works. [code=xml] <media type="video" width="720" height="405" thumb="images/thumb24.jpg" title="Video 24"> <url>http://myschoolsite.netne.net/other/Pong.flv</url> <description> <![CDATA[Some Random assed Custom Video.]]> </description> </media> [/code] Set "type" to "video". Set the url to any link with .flv.
What's <![CDATA[ ]]> It is the description of the video, if you click the little "i" above the video in the player.
See it in action: http://myschoolsite.netne.net/other/video.html
-just a site I use to upload what ever.
Images of it:
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/ig9vdfi.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Vb4izmZ.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/DdRIrJc.png[/img]
Comments/Questions?
Note, this can virtually load as many videos as you'd like. It loads them in blocks of 12.

item.title: Youtube/Vimeo Gallery XML/AS3
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:481068”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=599306.msg4212375#msg4212375 date=1359757524]

This beats Flash any day :p, good job.

Huh, AS3 is flash?

Wooooops, meant the flash project LOLOL.
[/quote]
I get more credit in school for doing this, believe it or not.
My teacher is like “Ooo nice flash project, +70 random points for you” etc.
He attempts to teach us html (still using elements, and some standards from 4.1); the issue being one day, we’ll make a file, get 3 tags in in an hour. The next day, he overviews everything we did the previous day (taking a good 15 minutes) and adds another 3-5 tags. He wastes so much damn time explaining tags. And if we happen to use a tag twice, say a div tag, he’ll explain it both times.

But thanks for the compliments, I’m happy you guys liked it.

It’s not online, but better?
-Didn’t edit the sprite sizes.

vjJLy2X.png1009×651
[/quote]
So much better

Read full topic

item.title: Youtube/Vimeo Gallery XML/AS3
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:2, topic:481068”]Text/icons inside the container need to be either a much lighter shade of grey or even white, literally squinting to see the length of the video, controls at the bottom should also span the entire width of the video in my opinion, looks odd.
Love the clean interface though now do it in HTML5, chop chop[/quote]
hehe html5 isn’t my strong suite.
I’ll make some modifications to it, when I get home.

Read full topic

item.title: Youtube/Vimeo Gallery XML/AS3
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well. You all didn’t seem to like my last project.
But this one is better, I swear.

I present to you: My Youtube video player.
Not only does it load youtube video’s. But it also can load Vimeo videos. And of course, videos from custom url’s.
Examples:
Vimeo:

	<media type="vimeo" width="720" height="405" thumb="images/thumb19.jpg" title="Video 20">
			<url>50671807</url>
			<description>
				<![CDATA[Some Random Assed Video off Vimeo.]]>
			</description>
		</media>

Make sure to set “type” to “vimeo”
All you do is add the end of the vimeo videos there. It’s always a string of numbers.
Youtube:

	<media type="youtube" width="720" height="405" thumb="images/thumb20.jpg" title="Video 19">
			<url>http://www.youtube.com/embed/9bZkp7q19f0</url>
			<description>
				<![CDATA[Some Random Assed Video off Youtube.]]>
			</description>
		</media>

Set “type” to “youtube”.
Then find a url off youtube, say: http://www.you tube.com/watch?v=9bZkp7q19f0
And change “watch?v=” to “embed/” You’re done.
Custom Video:
Wait… What’s a custom video? I mean custom video as in one loaded off a domain, ending with .flv.
Flash supports .flv only, which is a downfall, but. Yeah, it works.

<media type="video" width="720" height="405" thumb="images/thumb24.jpg" title="Video 24">
<url>http://myschoolsite.netne.net/other/Pong.flv</url>
<description>
<![CDATA[Some Random assed Custom Video.]]>
</description>
</media>

Set “type” to “video”.
Set the url to any link with .flv.

What’s
It is the description of the video, if you click the little “i” above the video in the player.

See it in action:

Free Web Hosting

Free Web Hosting - Your Website need to be migrated

Absolutely Free Web Hosting with PHP, MySQL, cPanel and no Ads!

-just a site I use to upload what ever.

Images of it:

Comments/Questions?

Note, this can virtually load as many videos as you’d like. It loads them in blocks of 12.
